column1: (Amendment) Bill of 2003 [Decisions of the Supreme Court on Parliamentary Bills 1999-
2003, Vol. VII, page 435 at page 437], it was held that:
“ (ii) Sec(cid:415)on 2(1) of the original Act empowers a lending ins(cid:415)tu(cid:415)on to have recourse
to the special procedure to recover a debt due to such ins(cid:415)tu(cid:415)on. The term ‘debt’ is
deﬁned in Sec(cid:415)on 30 as amended by Act No. 9 of 1994. In terms of this deﬁni(cid:415)on a
debt would include any sum of money which is due to a lending ins(cid:415)tu(cid:415)on arising
from a transac(cid:415)on had in the course of its business. It is signiﬁcant that the deﬁni(cid:415)on
has a clear reserva(cid:415)on that a debt ‘does not include a sum of money owed under a
promise or agreement which is not in wri(cid:415)ng’.
